brewery.name: Resignation Brewery
brewery.description:
If you show up to theCHIVE office for a tour, the first thing that happens is you'll be led to theCHIVE's famous beer fridge. Taking a tour without a beer in hand is a silly thing. When you open the fridge you notice a selection of the best beers around. At your eye level you'll find curious row of humble beers marked 'KCCO' on masking tape. It’s time to share our special home brew. Resignation Brewery was born to make the highest quality beer possible here in America.

As theCHIVE moves forward, our primary interest is in connecting people. It's what our shirts do amazingly well. There isn't anything wrong with the digital likes, pokes, and winks in the digital space. But nothing beats a physical connection. - A room full of friends, laughter, and raised glasses. Now the Chivers have a great, American beer to toast.

brewery.name: Zilker Brewing Co.
brewery.description: A craft brewery and taproom focusing on the American Belgo-Style while brewing a wide array of interesting and classic beers.

brewery.name: Uncle Billy's Brewery
brewery.description:
Uncle Billy’s Brewery is located in the heart of South Austin on Barton Springs Road, with a short walk to Barton Springs Pool and Zilker Park.
Uncle Billy's Brewery and Barbecue features a brewery on site serving hand crafted beers by brewer Michael Waters. Uncle Billy's offers a delicious menu that includes barbecue, burgers and salads. Enjoy drinks and live music on the dog friendly outdoor patio.

Award-winning beers from on-site microbrewery & delicious BBQ! Daily specials, happy hour & outdoor seating.

brewery.name: Hops & Grain Brewery
brewery.description: Hops and Grain is a local Austin brewery that produces hand-crafted ales and handmade dog treats. We are very passionate about our craft and strive to create sustainability in everything that we do

brewery.name: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In
brewery.nameShortDisplay: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In
brewery.description:
We’ve been retailing here since 1986, the Topiwala family with mom and pop and three brothers as well as the help of a handful of invaluable staff members. Pop started in the recession years of Reaganomics, thru the boom of Clintonia and still strong despite George II & the current class wars. Starting as a convenience store & gas station, we’ve been evolving from pretty much day one, trying to offer quality and service like our friendly Travis Heights neighbors and fellow Austinites deserve.

We are committed to sustainable, local, and organic & natural produce and groceries with our offerings on the shelf as well as our kitchen menu (No high fructose corn syrup or MSG!!!) With 72 taps of beer available, we are quite picky on what we present with only quality brews that go with our food.

We also enjoy giving back to the community with nonprofit fundraisers and support for grassroots organizations.

We serve our very own authentic and unique Gujarati-style Indian food, mom approved.

Beer by the pint & wine by the glass make it that much more of a yummy pairing.

Our own brews are specifically designed for our menu items!

Also enjoy live music in our unique intimate and awesome music room, or at least our staff selections of eclectic tunes.

brewery.name: Live Oak Brewing Company
brewery.description: Live Oak Brewing Company is truly a home-grown Austin enterprise. Two of Austin's own homebrews, Chip McElroy and Brian Peters, literally hand-built the brewery and were the two main brewers, keg washers, delivery persons, and proselytizers. Live Oak has grown since then, but we are still just as passionate about providing delicious old-world style beers that are rarely commercially available. Our special beers are brewed in limited quantities in a small east Austin brewery and are available in fine pubs and restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston, Alpine, Marathon, San Marcos and San Antonio.

brewery.name: The Austin Beer Garden Brewing Company
brewery.description:
brewery/venue/restaurant/ 
/good people
/nice place to hang
/creative community

--beer makes it better.

brewery.name: Austin Eastciders
brewery.description: Producers of Fine Cider for the Fine Folks of Austin!

Mon - Thu:	5:00 pm - 2:00 am
Fri - Sun:	1:00 pm - 2:00 am

brewery.name: Draught House Pub & Brewery
brewery.description:
We are an onsite brewpub that brews great ales and lagers.  If your looking for a fun, friendly casino with great award winning craft beer Dostal Alley is your place.

Ask about special parties. We have become famous for our birthday parties. We host many special holiday events. Watch our face book page to get the latest news.

brewery.name: Pinthouse Pizza
brewery.description: Pinthouse Pizza is a craft brewpub serving Austin's finest pizza and world class beers. The Pinthouse Pizza brewing style is a hop-forward, American-fusion style that emphasizes the flavor and aroma of the beloved hop flower without the traditional bitterness associated with hoppy beers. We are proud to be working with some of the best hop growers in the country and are excited to be showcasing these flavor profiles.

brewery.name: (512) Brewing Company
brewery.description: (512) Brewing is a microbrewery located in the heart of Austin, brewing for the community using as many local, domestic and organic ingredients as possible. We use USDA organic 2-row base malt because it's the right thing to do. We self distribute because we can and we're draft only to keep the product fresh and to reduce disposable packaging. You can taste the passion in our products and we appreciate all our local support.

brewery.name: Independence Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Rob and Amy Cartwright embarked on their dream to brew flavorful, delicious beers for the people of Austin in October 2004. Armed with their love of beer, years of brewing experience, an intrepid spirit, and their trusty dog Jasper, they founded Independence Brewing Company.

Located in southeast Austin, amongst tech companies and warehouse park entrepreneurs, Independence Brewing is a true reflection of the creative energy and pioneering spirit that makes Austin great.

What started with a married couple and their dog, has blossomed into a crew of nineteen and a community of beer drinkers who enjoy drinking fresh, handcrafted beer.

data.name: South Austin Brewery and Tasting Room

brewery.name: South Austin Brewery
brewery.description:
South Austin Brewery was established in 2014. South Austin Brewery has two flagship beers. Kol-Beer and our (TPA) Texas Pale Ale.  Kol’ Beer is our award winning Kolsch style beer and has quickly become a local favorite and the go to beer for many a Texan. A subtle malt character, balanced with the right amount of hops. Clean, crisp and refreshing. 
TPA is the state’s first Texas-style IPA, a sessionable and easy drinking, everyday IPA. Hoppy, clean and balanced. 
The Luckenbock is our traditional German style bock beer Garnet in color, big in flavor. Malty, earthy and crisp. 
We added two new beers this spring, Six-String Saison and Crossroads Coffee Stout. Six String is our non traditional take on the Franco- Belgian style farmhouse ale. Complex flavors. Spicy, citric and funky. The Cross Roads is a coffee stout with a unique blend of roasted barley, chocolate malt and oats. Infused with fresh roasted Brazilian micro lot coffee. Big, malty, roasted flavor. 
The latest addition to the line up is our Evel Ale. A Blonde All American Ale. Brewed in honor of the iconic daredevil Evel Knievel. “There’s a little Evel in all of us”

brewery.name: Brewery DADA
brewery.description: Brewery DADA has been in the minds of homebrewers Annie and Mercury McCall since they started brewing together in 2007. Their brews are marked by an adventurous spirit of invention and experimentation. They liken their brew style and aesthetic to the tenants of the DADA artistic movement, namely, a very specific absence of definitions and functions aligned with the propensity to collage and combine disparate ephemera.

brewery.name: Twin Peaks Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Located inside the Twin Peaks restaurant at the N. Irving, Texas location. This system has a 10,000 bbl. annual capacity and will supply all of the Twin Peaks locations in Texas.

data.name: Main Brewery
data.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Thursday: 4:00pm - Midnight
Friday - Saturday: 2:00pm - 1:00am
Sunday: 2:00pm - Midnight

brewery.name: Black Star Co-op Pub & Brewery
brewery.description:
With a special focus on local producers, the basic mission of the Black Star Co-op is to foster an environment in which member-owners, as well as the general public, may realize the principles of co-operative ownership, worker self-management, education and community action through the responsible enjoyment great beer and food.

As the first enterprise of this type, we seek to realize an alternative business model for brewpubs and to help expand the co-operative movement into new and innovative areas — both in Austin and around the world.

brewery.name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery
brewery.description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

brewery.name: Strange Land Brewery
brewery.description: Our story is not unlike many a beer journeyman before us—we’re intoxicated with the mystery of fermentation, the possibilities of taste, and chasing after unexplored horizons. Our goal is simply to make beer —

brewery.name: Meridian Hive Meadery
brewery.description: Artisan crafted honey wines in Austin, Texas. Filling your glass with history in the New World.

brewery.name: Austin Beerworks
brewery.description: Austin Beerworks is an owner-operated Texas brewery hell-bent on excellence. Our beers are canned for quality. We brew for two reasons: to make consistently exceptional craft beer, and to build community in the town we love.

brewery.name: Adelbert's Brewery
brewery.description:
Adelbert’s Brewery is committed to brewing Belgian-style, bottle-conditioned ales for people to seek, savor, and share with others.  We believe quality beers require quality ingredients and a painstaking attention to detail throughout the brewing process.  

Adelbert’s uses Bohemian old-world floor malted barley, low alpha Noble Czech hops, and fresh yeast propagated at the brewery. In our seven vessel brewhouse, we use a time consuming, multi-temperature decoction mash technique which extracts a more complex flavor from our grains.

We produce a gambit of hand-crafted Belgian style ales right here in Austin, Texas. With our vast array of beer styles, you're sure to find a brew that suits you.
 
Our Belgian-Style Ales include:
Naked Nun Wit
Black Rhino Black Ale
Scratchin' Hippo Biere de Garde
Philosophizer Saison
Dancin' Monks Dubbel Ale
Tripel B Tripel Ale
The Traveler Belgian IPA
Flyin' Monks Quadrupel Ale
 
Also, look for our Barrel-Aged "Vintage Series" where we age one of our eight ales in oak barrels for an extended period of time.

Although our selection of beer is great to enjoy by itself; each of them also pair perfectly with just about any food. From spicy Thai food to a backyard barbecue with ribs and brisket, to a formal dinner with steak or seafood and a dark chocolate dessert; our artisanal Belgian-style ales go with pretty much everything. Please share pictures and recipes that you've either used our beer to cook with or have enjoyed right alongside them!

brewery.name: 4th Tap Brewing Cooperative
brewery.description: Texas' first worker-owned cooperative brewery, opening soon. Come join us as we craft new faces for traditional styles and bring radical brewing to the forefront of the Texas craft beer scene. When all other beers fail to intrigue, try a 4th Tap.

brewery.name: North by Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
brewery.description:
North by Northwest came into existence from an idea that I had many years ago – that great craft brewed beer and fabulous food could come together in a fun and interesting atmosphere.

I chose the name North by Northwest because I wanted to convey the image of the Northwest where many brew pubs and micro-breweries got their start. Once settling on the name,the architecture and the image flowed naturally. Stone and wood are combined with the high vaulted ceiling to create the feel of those great lodges in our Northwest National parks.We have urbanized it a bit with the steel structure and industrial designed light fixtures. The Brewery Tower is a prominent feature along with the NXNW grain silos. The one directly in front of the Brewery Tower is a functioning silo full of 25,000 lbs. of barley – the major component ofthe beer making process. All the beers at NXNW are brewed right on site inside the Tower.

brewery.name: Circle Brewing Company
brewery.description: At Circle, all of our brews embody the concept of purity through simplicity of design.  You won’t find chemicals, stabilizing or clarifying agents, cheap additives or adjuncts, or even gimmicky fruits or spices in any of our brews.  At Circle, we embrace the German Purity standards of 1516 and continually brew better beer with that in mind.  To us, the circle is a symbol of perfection in its most basic form.  We share that perfection with you in every pint of Circle.

brewery.name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery
brewery.description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

brewery.name: Rogness Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Rogness Brewing Company specializes in creating small, handcrafted batches of beer. As decade long owners of a successful homebrew supply shop in Austin, TX, Forrest and Diane Rogness have experimented with many special hops and exotic ingredients. They are ready to share some of their more unique recipes with the world. Look for Rogness beers on draught, in cans, and bottles this Spring.
Forrest and Diane have been married for 13 years and have a 7 year old daughter named Anna. Forrest started brewing in 1990 and purchased Austin Homebrew Supply in 1999. He holds a degree in Photography.
Diane is originally from Iceland. She met Forrest at the University of Iowa and holds a degree in Art History.
The rest of the team is Dan Wheeler, David Heath, David Ebel, Mark Tovar, Tony Bailey, and Daron White. Including Forrest, they have over 65 years of brewing experience.

brewery.name: Oasis Texas Brewing Company
brewery.description: Producing iconic, rustic beers in the heart of the Texas Hill Country

brewery.name: Uncle Billy's Brewery
brewery.description:
Uncle Billy’s Brewery is located in the heart of South Austin on Barton Springs Road, with a short walk to Barton Springs Pool and Zilker Park.
Uncle Billy's Brewery and Barbecue features a brewery on site serving hand crafted beers by brewer Michael Waters. Uncle Billy's offers a delicious menu that includes barbecue, burgers and salads. Enjoy drinks and live music on the dog friendly outdoor patio.

Award-winning beers from on-site microbrewery & delicious BBQ! Daily specials, happy hour & outdoor seating.

data.name: Main Brewery
data.hoursOfOperation:
Sat:	11:00 am	-	2:00 pm

The tasting room is open from 11-3 every saturday by reservation ONLY.

brewery.name: Thirsty Planet Brewing Company
brewery.description:
We at Thirsty Planet Brewing believe our purpose is multi-faceted. It begins with just good, old-fashioned passion. Beer is our passion. We enjoy the history of beer, its humble, but amazing beginnings, the way it brings people together, and it’s unbelievable versatility. We truly believe you should follow your passion and enjoy life. How better to do that than open Thirsty Planet Brewing Company.

Our purpose then morphs into doing the right thing. For us, this includes being environmentally conscious. We have laced filters in our drains for run-off water, so we can use that water to irrigate our lawns and plants. We also plan to purchase solar panels for our brewery. We recycle, and you will quickly learn that after visiting our beautiful tasting room. Check out our bar, you will see what we mean.

Another important aspect of doing the right thing is through charitable donations. We have been truly blessed in life and want to give to those who are in need of a blessing. A portion of our Yellow Armadillo Wheat sales will go to a local cancer research/support foundation, and a portion of our Thirsty Goat Amber sales will go to help purchase farm animals (maybe goats?) for needy people in third world countries. So, not only can we feel good for helping people, you can feel good every time you purchase Thirsty Planet beer. It’s a win-win situation!!!

brewery.name: Infamous Brewing Company
brewery.description:
The team at IBC hails from a diverse background spanning multiple industries who have settled in ATX from other parts of Texas and from both the East and West Coasts. 
We have been home brewing for quite some time and now we are taking that passion to the next level by offering our creations to as many people as possible.
We are currently in the initial stages of development and hope to begin production by year end. Given the strict licensing process, it will probably be sometime in early 2013 before we can share our beers with the rest of Austin, but we are working hard to make that happen as soon as legally possible.
Much more information will be coming on our planned initial beer selection. In the meantime, continue to check back for updates and continue to spread the word!

brewery.name: Twin Peaks Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Located inside the Twin Peaks restaurant at the N. Irving, Texas location. This system has a 10,000 bbl. annual capacity and will supply all of the Twin Peaks locations in Texas.

brewery.name: Jester King Craft Brewery
brewery.description: Located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country, Jester King Craft Brewery is an authentic farmhouse brewery committed to brewing artisan ales of great depth and character. At times drawing influences from the world beyond traditional brewers’ yeast, Jester King’s beer is not rushed to market but allowed to mature – often in oak barrels – to create the most enjoyable, interesting and exciting beer we can make. An additional layer of complexity is added to Jester King’s bottled beers by allowing a second fermentation to take place in the bottle. As part of its commitment to sustainability, the slow food movement and Texas, Jester King beer uses as many organic and local ingredients as possible and will soon be brewed with harvested rainwater.

brewery.name: Flix Brewhouse
brewery.description: Flix Brewhouse America’s Cinema Brewery - the only first run movie theatre in the world to incorporate a fully functioning microbrewery. By combining these concepts, Flix delivers to your theatre seat three of America’s great loves - craft beer, great food and the latest movies! All six of our stadium seating “dining rooms” are outfitted with the latest high-definition digital projection and sound technologies, wall-to-wall curved screens and feature our revolutionary Easy Glider moveable table top. We brew six beers of our own and offer 42 other draft beers for guests to enjoy. The Flix Mix lobby bar and cafe is open seven days a week to public, no ticket required, so you can come in and grab a bite to eat or have a locally brewed beer anytime!

brewery.name: Bluebonnet Beer Company
brewery.description: Small craft brewery in Round Rock, TX owned and operated by a husband and wife team focused on brewing high-quality classic beer styles with a Texas twist.

brewery.name: Smoke'n Hops
brewery.description: We are a locally owned company and group of friends who are very passionate about Texas BBQ, good Texas craft beers, and live music. We've had a vision of a business that could bring the very best in these things together, and now our vision has become reality. Smoke 'n Hops will brew our own beer on site, smoke our own Texas-style BBQ, and bring in prominent musicians as well as local acts with ties to the community. It is very important to us to tie these things in with a fun, family-oriented environment. Therefore we have installed a playground so the younger ones are having fun while the older ones are at play.

brewery.name: Red Horn Coffee House & Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Located in Cedar Park, Texas, Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Co. offers fresh house roasted coffees and house brewed beer. With a focus on supporting other local artisans, Red Horn also offers locally sourced baked goods, charcuterie, cheeses, sodas, kombucha, wine, and a variety of sandwiches, salads and other artisan coffee and craft beer. Whether it’s sitting at the bar, lounging on a couch, or listening to local live music, our atmosphere is laid back and inviting. Come hang out with us.

brewery.name: Solid Rock Brewing
brewery.description: We brew our beers to fit like your favorite pair of jeans.

brewery.name: Twisted X Brewing Company
brewery.description: Tex Mex Beer - Mexican style Lagers with a Texas twist.

brewery.name: Bindlestick Brewery
brewery.description:
Bindlesticks are the iconic symbols of early 20th century America and what the hobos used to carry their belongings when they traveled from town to town looking for work. What they carried in those bags are tastes and experiences from each of the locations they visited.

A time when each town had a different beer that highlighted local ingredients. We wish to resurrect some of these fine brews from old as well as new creations celebrating the variety and flavor.

We will highlight local ingredients that show how beautiful this great state of Texas is!

brewery.name: Bastrop Brewhouse
brewery.description: Bastrop's First Brewpub!

brewery.name: Rentsch Brewing
brewery.description: Rentsch Brewery is a craft brewery located in Georgetown, Texas focusing on German style beers.

brewery.name: Darkside Fermentation
brewery.description: Come in and try some our great beer brewed in-house. A instant hit, we have many seasonal flavors to choose from.

brewery.name: The Root Cellar Cafe and Brewery
brewery.description:
We are the first and only brew pub in San Marcos, Texas.

Meet our brewer, Robert Brushaber. He has been homebrewing since the 90′s, and has graduated from the American Brewers Guild with a Craft Brewers Apprenticeship (CBA) in 2010. He apprenticed at the Real Ale Brewery in Blanco, and began brewing at the Root Cellar in 2012. The house beers brewed by Robert are Alison’s Ale, Cream Steam, Santa Fe Stout, and a Gluten Free IPA.

Alison’s Ale - A highly complex, clean and refreshing taste with a blend of six different malts and three different hops.

Cream Steam - Steam Beers are in a category all their own. Is it a lager? Is it an ale? Actually, it’s a lager brewed at ale temperatures. This higher temperature fermentation produces a beer with more “fruity” qualities than your average lager. The hops are 100% Northern Brewer, but Robert has lowered the hop bill to make this Steam Beer a bit more creamy and smooth.

Santa Fe Stout – This dry Stout, moderately bittered with Kent Golding hops, has flavor notes that remind me of a cup of dark coffee sipped from a warm mug on a cold Santa Fe morning.

Gluten Free Beer - Made with Sorghum, Honey, and Hops.

brewery.name: Sean Patrick's Irish Pub and Texas Grub
brewery.nameShortDisplay: Sean Patrick's Irish Pub and Texas Grub
brewery.description: Irish Brewpub and Texas Grill

brewery.name: Middleton Brewing
brewery.description: Middleton Brewing is a 10-barrel brewpub located in the heart of the Texas Hill Country.We special in Beglian and West Coast style ales.

brewery.name: Double Horn Brewing Company
brewery.description: Double Horn Brewing is a family-friendly restaurant serving lunch, dinner and a kid's menu. Double Horn is also the only brewery in Burnet County.

brewery.name: Save the World Brewing Co.
brewery.description:
Artisanal Belgian style ales making you feel good on so many levels.

After years of perfecting our recipes and with the use of only the best grains, hops and yeast, we feel our beers are raising the bar to the next level for the craft brewery movement. Grab a bottle of one our beers and decide for yourself, knowing that you're helping to Save The World one beer at a time!
 
We offer beer brewing classes and tasting parties by appointment only,

Wed - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm
Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

brewery.name: Pecan Street Brewing
brewery.description:
Pecan Street Brewing and Restaurant — a place to visit with old friends and make new ones! We are located in Johnson City, in the heart of the scenic Texas Hill Country, at 106 E. Pecan — directly across from the historic Courthouse.

We feature hand-crafted beers brewed on premise for the freshest beer you can drink! And for your friends who might prefer a glass of wine, we also have Texas Wines! 

Our menu includes brick oven pizzas, burgers and more, using fresh and local ingredients.

There is live music every Friday and Saturday night, with Sunday being the open mic night!

brewery.name: BS Brewing
brewery.description: Our grand opening is scheduled for mid March! We are hoping to start brewing our first batches within a couple of weeks. Until we have officially opened in March, the brewery is closed to tours and tastings. We will make an announcement as soon as you are able to come and take a tour!

brewery.name: Real Ale Brewing Company
brewery.description: Welcome to the Texas Hill Country - the home of Real Ale Brewing Company, where a dedicated team of brewers produces quality handcrafted ales. Utilizing a 60-barrel stainless steel brewing system, we incorporate 100% malted grain, domestic and imported hops, and crystal clear water into our unique recipes. We've been brewing since 1996, and now you can find Real Ale all over the Lone Star State. If you don't see us at your favorite stores, bars, and restaurants, make sure to ask for us by name! Cheers and thanks for your support!

brewery.name: Faust Brewing Company
brewery.description: The Faust Brewing Company features an array of house brews, including Faust Golden Ale, Altered States German Altbier and Mike Crowe IPA and Walter's Ghostly Pale Ale, as well as a variety of seasonal favorites. Leading the production is Ray Mitteldorf, a professional brew master with 17 years experience. For a complete experience, the pub features a tapas-style menu, created by Chef Chris Kilisz....See More

brewery.name: New Braunfels Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Founded in early 2011 by the Meyer family, we're inspired to brew our locally hand-crafted beer by old-word German recipes. What goes in our beer is as much local wheat, local water and local passion as we can get our hands on. 

Our beers go right up to the edge of the style and take one defiant step over it. We make beer that tastes great and refreshes the soul. we don't care whether or not it 'fits the style'. 

Order a glass of NBBCo and experience something different

brewery.name: Guadalupe Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Guadalupe Brewing Company is a new locally owned Craft Beer manufacturer in New Braunfels, Texas. Our goal is to provide the freshest possible product and use the highest quality ingredients available. We will use organic ingredients whenever possible and it is our goal to minimize energy and water use to be responsible stewards of our environment. It is also our goal to give back to the community in the form of support for natural resources and parks of Texas.

Look for our beer in finer restaurants and pubs in the Texas Hill Country.

brewery.name: Seguin Brewing Co.
brewery.description: SMALL TOWN, BIG NUTS!

brewery.name: 5 Stones Artisan Brewery
brewery.description: We are a small batch nano-brewery located "down around" San Antone. Our primary focus is limited releases each season brewed with the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on.

brewery.name: Twin Peaks Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Located inside the Twin Peaks restaurant at the N. Irving, Texas location. This system has a 10,000 bbl. annual capacity and will supply all of the Twin Peaks locations in Texas.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

brewery.name: Branchline Brewing Co.
brewery.description:
Branchline Brewing Company is a production brewery based out of San Antonio, TX. We focus on high quality craft beer utilizing local and regional ingredients whenever possible. Branchline Brewing Company's focus is not only to provide our offering to the extreme craft beer drinker, but also to the casual drinker that enjoys a lighter product. 

Handcrafted ales for the independent at heart

brewery.name: Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling
brewery.description: Ranger Creek is a combined brewery/distillery proudly located in San Antonio, TX. We make beer and whiskey in our “brewstillery”, and we make it by hand one batch at a time with lots of love and attention. As a combined operation, we use much of the same equipment to make both our beer and our whiskey, and we can do this because there are a lot of similarities between the two processes. It’s actually a really cool process to see, and we invite you to come take a tour and learn about it for yourself.

brewery.name: Pete's Brewing
brewery.description:
Founded by homebrewer Pete Slosberg and Mark Bronder in 1986, helping to pioneer the craft beer movement.

Exclusively brewed under contract by Matt Brewing Company of Utica, NY, best known for their Saranac line.

Sold to the Gambrinus Company in 1998.

Sadly, ceased production in spring 2011 after declining sales under Gambrinus ownership.

brewery.name: Spoetzl Brewery
brewery.description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.

brewery.name: Freetail Brewing Company
brewery.description:
#1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".

Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.

We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.

Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.

brewery.name: Pedernales Brewing Company
brewery.description: Pedernales Brewing Company is proud to announce their highly anticipated opening in the city of Fredericksburg, Texas. Texas Hill Country's newest microbrewery will feature Classic and German-style beers. PBC’s impressive lineup of beers will include skillfully crafted lagers and ales. At this time we are offering our flagship brands; LOBO and LOBO Negro. “LOBO” is the name of the WOLF native to Texas and the Southwest.  Sadly, the wolf was almost wiped out by big ranchers some 100 years ago; not unlike the small craft brewers who were similarly annihilated by prohibition.

brewery.name: Fredericksburg Brewing Company
brewery.description:
We began our operation in 1994, within months of the passage of legislation allowing brewpub operation in the state of Texas. We found a public eagerly awaiting the enjoyment of our cold, freshly brewed beers along with our freshly prepared, flavorful foods.

Today we are the oldest brewpub in Texas, and have been proclaimed by numerous publications, as the "Best in Texas". Our reputation is confirmed by our award winning brews in both U.S. and International Competitions. Most importantly, is the reinforcement that we are doing things right, shown by the repetitive visits of our loyal guest from both near and far.

Fredericksburg Brewing Company claimed a gold medal at the 2008 Great American Beer Festival Competition, the largest national beer competition that recognizes the most outstanding beers produced in the United States today. We have been in operation since 1994 and have twice been proclaimed as the Best Brewpub in Texas, by Texas Monthly. In addition to the 2008 gold medal for our Hauptstrasse Helles (Mainstreet Light), previous silver and bronze medals have been received for our Porter and Red Ale.

We are located at 245 East Main Street which is in the heart of the historic, downtown shopping district in beautiful Fredericksburg, Texas. To house our operations, we restored a great two story 1890s building to historical standards. The first floor of the building provides space for our dining area, our large air-conditioned biergarten, and a lager room with retail space.The second floor provides space for our unique "Bed & Brew" facilities. There are twelve rooms with baths, each decorated in a different theme.

In our fair little town, sidewalk consumption is allowed, so that you can take our cold brews on your sidewalk stroll.

brewery.name: Dodging Duck Brewhaus
brewery.description: The Dodging Duck Brewhaus is located in Boerne, Texas, in the Texas Hill Country. We have an eclectic menu of international and local favorites, from Thai Lettuce Wraps to Chimichurri Grilled Beef Tenderloin to Bratwurst & Sauerkraut. Best of all, we brew great beer! We've already won three gold and three silver medals at the World Beer Championships!

brewery.name: Boerne Brewery
brewery.description:
We are a microbrewery nestled in the Texas Hill Country. We are small and intend to stay that way. We are from Boerne. We will be brewing in Boerne. Our beer is for the people that live in, work in, and visit Boerne.
We are painfully/cheerfully close to completing construction. We will continue to post updates and pictures as things go along.

brewery.name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery
brewery.description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

brewery.name: Twin Peaks Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Located inside the Twin Peaks restaurant at the N. Irving, Texas location. This system has a 10,000 bbl. annual capacity and will supply all of the Twin Peaks locations in Texas.

brewery.name: Twin Peaks Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Located inside the Twin Peaks restaurant at the N. Irving, Texas location. This system has a 10,000 bbl. annual capacity and will supply all of the Twin Peaks locations in Texas.

brewery.name: Alamo Beer Co
brewery.description:
Alamo Beer Company is the brainchild of Eugene Simor of San Antonio, Texas. Handcrafted just a day’s ride from the Alamo. So the next time you’re in town, remember to raise some ale.

We deliver pure & honest Texas beer. A smooth and refreshing golden ale brewed with a fiercely independent spirit.

brewery.name: Busted Sandal Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Busted Sandal Brewing Company is founded on the idea with the thought in mind that a great beer can be hand-crafted with locally sourced seasonal ingredients where possible and brewed in a facility that is energy efficient and powered solely by renewable energy sources. Tapping our combined 27 years of brewing experience, our members pledge to deliver not only beers that are bold and unique in character and offer frequent seasonal offerings that keep beer connoisseurs craving the next batch, but also easy-drinking session beers to be enjoyed by all.

We pride ourselves in the betterment of the craft beer industry as a whole and pledge to work together with, not compete with other local craft breweries. We want help to foster a community of craft beer creativity and excitement in the communities we deliver our beer to.

brewery.name: Southernleigh
brewery.description:
Southerleigh, Fine Food & Brewery, will be the new restaurant in the Historic Brewhouse at Pearl. Named for the prevailing Gulf breeze and the Texas coast’s proud sense of place, Southerleigh will serve Chef Jeff Balfour’s modern take on Texas’ cross-cultural cuisine from seafood, to beef, to small plates. The on-premise brewery will offer a rotating array of original recipe, craft batch beers from Master Brewer, Les Locke.

Southerleigh is rooted at the unique intersection of cultures that make up the storied richness of Texas and Pearl. This culinary crossroads (Coastal, Cowboy, Spanish, German, Creole... all the flavors of Texas’ historic roux) is where Chef Jeff Balfour, born in Galveston, crafts a cuisine of both contemporary wit and breezy Southern charm.

Whether you‘re enjoying date night in the majestic dining rooms or catching up with old friends in the Beer Garden - May Our Paths Cross at Southerleigh.

data.name: The Granary 'Cur & Brew
data.hoursOfOperation:
Lunch from Tuesday - Saturday:
11:00am- 2:00pm

Tuesday - Thursday:
6:00p.m - 10:00p.m.
Friday - Saturday:
6:00p.m. - 11:00p.m.

brewery.name: The Granary 'Cue & Brew
brewery.description:
We strive to make fresh, handcrafted, honest beers that can be enjoyed by all.  All of our beer is made within the four walls of our restaurant, which means that when it hits your glass it is the freshest beer you can get.   Our beers are never filtered or pasteurized and are always full of character and flavor.  We brew styles from American and Belgian to anything in between.  We typically brew our beers with four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and San Antonio water.   However we have been known to add things like coffee, fruit, spices, and anything else that might catch our fancy.

At The Granary we love beer as beer helps to enrich our lives.  We take our beer and food seriously and we hope to politely challenge people’s perspective of how beer can be paired with food.  We believe that every meal that is served can be made better when paired with the right style of beer.  This is not your grandma’s beer.

brewery.name: Pabst Brewing Company
brewery.description: At Pabst Brewing Company, we make beer with history, with a sense of place. From Milwaukee to Motown, through the Pacific Northwest and back East again, our brands are like family and hometown friends. And we should know a little something about regional pride: Since we started in 1844, we've welcomed 24 new states into the Union. Today, Pabst crafts over 25 classic brews with strict adherence to original standards of quality. Our brands rack up national and international festival awards. Most important, they continue to make memories in the places that mean a lot to our consumers.

brewery.name: Blue Star Brewing Company
brewery.description: Owned and operated by Joey and Maggie Villarreal of Joey's on N. St. Mary's Street, the BSBC has been open since June 25, 1996. We offer medal-winning beers, an exceptional wine list, and delicious food. The brew pub is located in the Blue Star Arts Complex at 1414 S. Alamo, on the San Antonio river across the street from the Pioneer flour mill. The stainless steel vats and brewing facility are right at home in what was once an old beer storage warehouse. Friendly staff and warm wood decor make for a comfortable, casual atmosphere.

brewery.name: Brazos Valley Brewing Company
brewery.description: BVB was founded in 2013 by a five man team of craft brewing enthusiasts. We make high quality craft beers for the people of Texas and have a variety of styles thoughtfully created using our passion for tasteful ales.

brewery.name: Pint & Plow Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Developing community by connecting people, place, and history through beer and food crafted from real ingredients. We are the first and only craft brewery in Kerrville, creating a new industry and gathering place of which people in the community can be proud.

brewery.name: New Republic Brewing Company
brewery.description: An Aggie owned & operated nanobrewery. Distributing to Bryan & College Station.

brewery.name: Tree Farm Brewing Company
brewery.description: A love affair with good beer.

brewery.name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery
brewery.description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

brewery.name: Scars & Stripes Brewing Company
brewery.description:
The name really says it all. Four Army veterans got together one day to brew beer and talk about movies, music, video games, and life which then turned into a regular home brewing event. Not too long afterwards, it was noticed that the city of Waco, Texas didn't have a microbrewery to call its own to accommodate a growing music scene and its relaxed college atmosphere. It only seemed obvious what the next move would be.

Even though the brew-masters and owners are Army Veterans, the name Scars & Stripes stands as tribute all military veterans as a thank you for the sacrificing that has been done so everyone can live free. The mentality behind this company is not your Captain America patriotism, but rather one that embraces Independence and freedom for all with no judgement for lifestyle choices.

We will be Waco's only micro brewery! Our beer will be self distributed around various stores and restaurants in the Central and Northern Texas area but we will also have regular taste testings for anyone who is of legal drinking age to take a tour of the brewing facility and to get a free try of the craft beer we are creating. Shirts, glasses, stickers, and growlers will be available for purchase.

brewery.name: Huff Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Located in Austin County, Texas, we’re committed to crafting our beer to complement our history, customs, and lifestyles. We always brew with a respectful nod toward tradition before looking forward to produce beer with a worthy amount of creativity, adventure, and independence. The result is our idea of a good beer: one we enjoy.
 
We hope you agree. Here’s to sharing a beer with you soon — Cheers!
